Name: The Bygone Shall Always Return
QuestDesc: To open the Sentinel's Relic, you head back to Ragunna once more...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A few of our friends are already in the city. Seems they're digging into these incidents too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd suggest having a little chat with them first. We'll gather more intel on our end as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Long time no see, Ragunna!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm—mmm—! Can you smell that? Sweet o' Margherita's Restaurant. C'mon, c'mon, let's go stuff our faces already!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's take care of important matters first. You'll eat well soon, I promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, yeah, I know. We're here to find Cartethyia!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still can't believe Tethys couldn't unlock the Sentinel's Relic we found in Septimont...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At least now we know it's called the "Civilization Capsule." It probably holds key legacy data left behind by the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like some ancient data recorder, right? But Tethys said to unlock it we'll need... the Leviathan's power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it's really from the Sentinel, why do we need the Threnodian's power for that?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe because they fused together at some point...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh well, guess that's why we need to find Cartethyia. Maybe she'll know a workaround...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores warned that the waters in Ragunna are acting weird again. Gotta be extra careful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you know... something feels off in the city too. It's not as cheerful as when we left it.

Options.PlotLineKey: I think things do feel more tense.
Might just be the weather.
There is a sorrow in the air...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, and they just threw a huge Carnevale not long ago too...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... you might be onto something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... since when did you get all poetic?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Amid howling winds, rising storms, and ghosts adrift, I heard the captain's call—

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look! Over there! Isn't that Brant and Roccia? Wow, the Troupe of Fools is putting on a show!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hoist the sails, O humanity! The abyss and the summit have entwined. Your only path now is forward, bold and uncharted!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You stand on the precipice. Now is the hour to decide your fate—to plant the seed of your highest hope and watch it bloom into tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Captain, why do you burn alone in your own flames?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you do not first become ashes, how will you rebuild?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Embrace your fire. Embrace your grief. Go into your solitude! I love those who dare to create, who strive to transcend, for in doing so, their old selves are destroyed. Yes, so they might reach the shores of a new life!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To journey onward is perilous. To stand still is perilous. To look back is also perilous. To tremble and falter... is perilous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I begin to understand what truly makes a hero great. It is to stand before humanity's deepest sorrow and its highest hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, how I love those whose souls remain rich and vast, even when wounded. Even when the smallest risk could spell doom, they leap without hesitation into the unknown.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should you stand alone, suffering in the endless dark... Today, may you hold fast to every last ember of courage and hope!

Dialogues.Speaker: Onlookers
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bravo! Bravo!
Life... is but a walking shadow.
A poor player, who struts and frets his hour upon the stage... and then is heard no more.
It is a tale told by fools, full of sound and fury... Signifying nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
On your earlier journey through Septimont, you recovered the Sentinel's Relic from the Earthrend Wedge. To unlock it, you returned to the Black Shores seeking Tethys's aid. Its analysis revealed it to be the Civilization Capsule, likely containing the Sentinel's legacy data. But for reasons unknown, it requires the combined forces of both the Sentinel and the Threnodian to open. With no clear solution, you return once again to Ragunna, hoping to find answers from Cartethyia in the Inverted Tower.

Back in Ragunna, however, the atmosphere is thick with a strange tension. The only splash of color comes from a Troupe of Fools performance. As you and Abby pause to watch, Cristoforo's whisper slips into your ear...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where... am I?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was Cristoforo's voice just now... Is this another one of his illusions?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Buling's bronze mirror isn't responding... Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...No answer. This isn't like what happened in Septimont. Guess I can only keep moving and find out why.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Amid the endless cycle of surging tides, she plunges into fate's swirling maelstrom once more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Soon, she will wear a new crown—one ordained by fate, never to be defied.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her fate was written long ago. What remains is but a fleeting moment of stolen peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you see before you... is fate itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now, with every step you take, you stir the tides into motion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it fate that rules over man, or man who commands fate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I await your answer to this question...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is this place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Inscribed Words
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through me, walk the Path of Glorious Ascension... Through me, enter the City of Eternal Bliss... All who enter... must first forsake all Hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (These Tacet Discords... why aren't they attacking?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Devotees
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Harbinger... Open... The gates of Paradise for us...
You'd better leave. This place... isn't leading to any "salvation."
Leviathan, I will deliver you... "her death."

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Cristoforo's whisper pulls you into unconsciousness. When you awaken, you find yourself in a mysterious realm.

Visions of fallen companions appear along the path as Cristoforo's whisper continues. Fighting the unease, you reach a lake where in the distance a vast "Paradise" hangs above.

As you stand in disbelief, several Tacet Discords emerge behind you, not to attack, but to chant the title "Harbinger." Then, from the darkness, a strange woman steps forward. With a single demonic arm, she unleashes a surge of flame that casts you from the realm. Her final words: "Leviathan, I will deliver you... 'her death.'"

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}... {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We could try this... "Nightmare Awakener"—

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm up, I'm up!
Good, you're all okay...
I think I saw Paradise...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're finally awake, {PlayerName}! One second I'm fine, the next my head's spinning and you're face-down on the ground...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm fine. What I saw, though…

Options.PlotLineKey: (Recount what you saw)

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Sounds like the same thing happening to the people here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what I've heard, many Ragunnesi have been having peculiar dreams lately. Even some of our Troupe members too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The details vary, but they all end the same way... the fall of Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it's not just in dreamland either... {PlayerName}, I'm not sure if you've heard, but there have been strange rumors appearing across Rinascita lately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even in Septimont, folks claim they've seen Tacet Discords not of this land in the wilds, or the ghosts of their ancestors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to all these oddities, the mood in Ragunna has gone sour.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Troupe performed today because Brant thought a new play to lighten the mood might give the people some hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But here's the odd part. Only Rinascitans seem to be having these dreams. Visitors are spared... the same should be true of you.

Options.PlotLineKey: Have any of you had similar dreams?
Have you seen other anomalies like this?
I'll get to the bottom of what's happening.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... Not Brant or me. But someone in the Troupe has. They said they dreamed of sinking into an enormous, black ocean...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tacet Discords in the Stormy Sea have been more restless lately. And the "siren's" songs? Well, they've started sounding an awful lot like the Order's hymns...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll keep gathering intel on our end. Might be worth asking around the city to see who else has been experiencing this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita's tides don't lie. Watch your back, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (What were those Tacet Discords whispering about? Gates of Paradise... and the word "Harbinger." Could they mean the "Harbinger of the Dark Tide"?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The only "Harbinger of the Dark Tide" is Fenrico. But he should still be sealing the Dark Tide at the Order's Fabricatorium...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That figure I saw... and Cartethyia's murder...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I came back to find her, so I should look for her first. She might know what's at the root of all this.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You regain consciousness under the Troupe's care. What happened feels like an "illusion," but the Troupe members tell you that many in Ragunna have suffered similar "symptoms." Meanwhile, across Rinascita, anomalies have begun to appear.

You recall what you saw in the "illusion": the chanting Tacet Discords, the strange woman, and a vision of Cartethyia's murder. Maybe you can search the city for clues... or maybe the answer lies with Cartethyia herself, the very reason you returned to Ragunna.

Chapters.Title: Ride the Wingray to the Inverted Tower

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that... Cantarella up ahead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}? What brings you back to the Inverted Tower so suddenly?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something's come up. I need Cartethyia's help to deal with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did something unusual happen here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've only just arrived. For now, everything appears to be in order. I didn't come because of any disturbance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are matters I, too, need to discuss with Cartethyia...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: BANG—!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the Inverted Tower, you come across Cantarella, head of the Fisalias. Before you can ask her why she is there, the sharp sound of shattering windows pierces the air…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How could this happen...

Options.PlotLineKey: ...It all happened so fast.
...I'll make her pay. Blood for blood!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That woman...
Leviathan, I will deliver you... "her death."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Why… Why does this scene match what I saw in that dreamland?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her Tacet Mark... Look, it's flickering! Cantarella, she's...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...No. Something's wrong. It's strange... I can't sense any frequency from her, and yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She is still resonating with... something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Resonator's frequency is usually gone when they die, right? This doesn't make any sense.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's something even stranger...

Options.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia's sword.
The shattered stained glass.
The shell casings on the floor.
None of this is adding up.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia had her sword in hand... With her strength, how could she fall to an intruder like that? And... it doesn't look like she even tried to resist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sword of Divinity, sealed with a portion of the Sentinel's power... Could what we're seeing be a result of that power of separation being awakened?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …The Inverted Tower itself is a sealed Sonoro. Only the Fisalias know it exists. So how did she find it?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And she broke through the stained glass from the outside. Physically, not by tearing through the Sonoro Sphere. But Cartethyia has complete control over the Tower. If someone had intruded, would she really not have noticed?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Spent casings... These traces, could they be from the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You bet they are! I'd know that stench anywhere. And I caught the same frequency on that freak who jumped out earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Cantarella, you never did get to say what brought you here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia reached out to me with an urgent matter to discuss. She gave no details, only insisting that I come at once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the strange phenomena stirring across Ragunna, I feared it might be linked to the Dark Tide. Or Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Was what I saw... really just an illusion? I saw this... her death, exactly as it's happening now.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That woman... she was using Dark Tide energy. Could she be another Harbinger?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Whatever the case, we need to find the one who did this. I want answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave Cartethyia to me. I'll bring her back to the Fisalia estate and keep her safe. The rest… I entrust to you.

Options.PlotLineKey: Abby, can you track the killer's frequency?
Abby, can you track the Dark Tide's frequency?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, this nose? I could track the Dark Tide blindfolded! Let's follow the stench and hunt down this killer!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The strange woman you saw in Cristoforo's "illusion" suddenly appears and shoots Cartethyia right before your eyes. She then summons an unfamiliar Tacet Discord that blocks Cantarella's attack before vanishing. You want to go after her immediately, but instead choose to stay and try to revive Cartethyia, clinging to a faint hope... But Cantarella tells you that her frequency has completely vanished.

Rage flares within you. You realize that the scene matches what you saw in the "illusion."

Just then, Cartethyia's Tacet Mark flickers, sparking a glimmer of hope. Cantarella senses that although Cartethyia's frequency is gone, she is still resonating with something.

After steadying yourself, you uncover more anomalies within the Tower. To protect Cartethyia's body, Cantarella takes her to the Fisalia estate, and you and Abby set out to track down the killer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's weird. The trail ends here, but... Ugh... My head's starting to spin again...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the Dark Tide's energy messing with you again. You can rest, I'll search the area.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby? Asleep already... That drowsiness should've worn off by now. Another side effect of the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since leaving the Inverted Tower, Ragunna's sky... what happened to it?
Spear of Glory... pierce through!
Slipped away again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By this spear, I vow to protect my allies and crush the hearts of the evil.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius? What are you doing out here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What any Gladiator of Septimont is born to do—hunting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you, Your Grace… You vanished without a word. What brings you back in such a hurry?

Options.PlotLineKey: After what happened before...
Tell me what you're doing here first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's a long story. Let's speak of more pressing matters. Are you after the Thundering Mephis as well?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. I'm tracking someone else.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Describe Cartethyia's killer.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Silver hair and violet eyes... cloaked in cursed, shadowlit flame. So you seek the one they call "<ano=TD Hunter>Discord Slayer</ano>."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Discord Slayer? Sounds like you know something about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, she's on my radar. I suspect the recent Tacet Discord outbreak in Ragunna City is tied to her presence.

Options.PlotLineKey: Wait, Ragunna City was attacked by a TD Outbreak?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your Grace hasn't heard? It struck not long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had gone there in search of the "Quillbearer." While gathering information, the city was suddenly overrun... To be precise, they looked more like "spawn of the Dark Tide."

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The outbreak has since been contained, but the Genesis Nexus was damaged. Without it, Common Echoes can't be used, and Ragunna is no longer secure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montellis and the Order agreed to evacuate all civilians to Averardo Vault, where Private Echoes can still be deployed. It's the only way to protect them.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (A TD Outbreak, right after I left... But while I was there, I didn't even sense a ripple.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Thundering Mephis has fled! The path ahead is safe!

Dialogues.Speaker: Resident of Egla Town
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your help, Gladiator! Averardo Vault isn't far from here. We can handle the rest of the journey!

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, about the Discord Slayer you seek. The townsfolk shared some troubling whispers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She may call herself that, but witnesses have seen her alongside swarms of Tacet Discords, leading them like troops into battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's more, many have confirmed that the unrest across Ragunna coincides exactly with her appearances. The time and place match perfectly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I even crossed paths with her on the road to Ragunna. I sensed a malicious frequency we both know well—the Dark Tide.

Options.PlotLineKey: That very frequency is what led me here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. Even if she didn't cause the outbreak in Ragunna City, the connection is undeniable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide is Rinascita's ancient enemy. If you're hunting her, allow me to join you and lend my aid.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have any leads on her whereabouts now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I'm correct, the Thundering Mephis we encountered is also a Dark Tide creation. This frequency it left behind…

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can track it, and from there, draw out the Discord Slayer herself. To that end, we'll need this.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An Anchor Stone? You brought that all the way from Septimont?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... A habit picked up on the hunt. You're no stranger to its use either, Your Grace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like I'm fortunate to be hunting alongside you again, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The killer's trail suddenly vanishes, leaving you no choice but to land and search the area for clues. Since leaving the Tower, the skies above Ragunna have looked distorted. As you ponder this, a Thundering Mephis ambushes from above. A spear knocks it away just in time. It is Avidius, your old comrade from Septimont.

You tell him about your hunt for Cartethyia's killer, and he tells you that soon after your departure, Ragunna City was attacked by Tidespawn. They destroyed the Genesis Nexus, making Common Echoes unusable. The Montelli family, after consulting with the Order, has begun to evacuate civilians to Averardo Vault. Avidius was escorting villagers from Egla Town through this area when he heard rumors about this killer. He, too, once crossed paths with her and sensed the Dark Tide's frequency within her. Together, you decide to hunt the Dark Tide's "Thundering Mephis," hoping it will lead you to the killer, the so-called "Discord Slayer."

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take note. Enemies ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Dark Tide creations. Grant them the oblivion they deserve.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a hollow existence. Who "scripted" your delusions?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mentioned you left Tetragon Temple to search for the "Quillbearer" here in Ragunna, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I grew weary of waiting. When I heard rumors of his presence in Ragunna, I came to find him myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No trace of him yet, but I've learned this much—Here, no verses were ever penned about me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Ragunnesi know not my name, past, nor the prophecy I once carried. Here... I am a completely blank page.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If my former "existence" was just a fabrication, an idea of some Hero of Heroes crafted to "Septimont's expectations"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then perhaps here in Ragunna, I am free to write my own story. Free to define my own "existence." Free to create a reality of my own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This... this matters more than finding him. I will break free from his narrative and become the master of my own destiny.

Options.PlotLineKey: Well said.
Now you're starting to sound like a true ruler.
I prefer you like this, honestly.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your fate is what you want it to be. No one else gets to decide who you are.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one has the right to dismiss your efforts and dreams with some absurd idea of destiny. You'll find your own Truth. I know it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You honor me. I hope to prove worthy of that belief.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During your pursuit of the Thundering Mephis, you learn that Avidius originally came to Ragunna in search of the Quillbearer. But along the way, he discovered something far more meaningful, a chance to be the master of his own destiny…

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Anchor Stone is holding strong. Let's push forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our destination is up ahead...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that an entrance to a Paradimensional Tacet Field?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ragunna's geographical records haven't documented this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you feel that? That ominous energy... the Anchor Stone confirms the Thundering Mephis is hiding here.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's prepare to enter it.
That's our best lead right now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. I stand with you. Whatever comes, you have my sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Together, you and Avidius follow the trail of the Dark Tide and discover a Paradimensional Tacet Field that shouldn't be there. Seeking the truth, you step boldly into it…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened? Where's Avidius? We crossed inside at the same time.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the Thundering Mephis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tidespawn: Thundering Mephis
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Open... the gates...
So you just barrel in without thinking...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That voice... the Discord Slayer? Is this her trap?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another illusion...
Focus. You are in an illusion. It's weaponizing your combat instincts.
Steady your resolve. Do not let its whispers sway you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The pain and hallucinations are fading... Is she helping me?
Good. See that Cocoon in the center? The Thundering Mephis is just bait. That right there is the core of this domain.
Destroy it. Then the monster and this illusion will unravel together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Within the Paradimensional Tacet Field, the illusion returns, disrupting your battle with the Thundering Mephis. From the darkness, the Discord Slayer's voice emerges, revealing a way to break free.

After breaking the illusion, you call out to her, but she doesn't seem to be there at all. Still, her words reach you: to prevent an even greater calamity, she too is searching for the Harbinger of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It worked... But—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are you?! And what did you do to Cartethyia?
...Now is not the time for stories.
But I'll tell you this. I'm here to kill the Harbinger of the Dark Tide. To stop a greater calamity.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't hear her voice anymore... Time to leave this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}! Are you unharmed? You vanished the moment we entered the Tacet Field.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm fine... So, it's gone? Avidius, did you see anything after we got separated?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Thundering Mephis was nowhere in sight. But I did observe a peculiar figure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I couldn't see his face clearly, but I heard him call himself... Caligula.

Options.PlotLineKey: Caligula...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Caligula was a tyrant feared throughout Septimont's history. Notorious for his cruelty that defied reason, the world remembers him as the "Mad King."

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legends say he wielded a vile black Resonance energy, and the worst calamities ever stirred by the Dark Tide all began with him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He didn't fight it. He embraced it. Commanded its abominations. Bent them to his will. In the end, the people rose against him... and struck him down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But not before he left a curse: "I shall become the very history and memory of Septimont. So long as fear lingers in your hearts, I shall return."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The power to command the Dark Tide's creations... Only a Harbinger could do that.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That Discord Slayer said she's hunting a Harbinger to stop a greater calamity. If that's true, then everything happening across Ragunna might be tied to the Harbinger.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She pulled me from the illusion. If she's the cause of this chaos, why help me?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This isn't making sense. Harbinger... who are you, really?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, traces of the Dark Tide's frequency still linger where the Paradimensional Tacet Field collapsed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Anchor Stone is useless now. The signal is blocked by some sort of spatial layer.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta said the Dark Tide spoke to her when it swallowed her whole. Maybe... I can learn something that way.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My telepathic ability should give me a way in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Telepathy? Your Grace is versed in many arts. I don't doubt your abilities, but this is the Dark Tide. Reckless contact could—

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't want to see... another tragedy like what befell Septimont.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let me at least try.
It's just a meeting of minds.
I won't make direct contact.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're falling behind. The Discord Slayer knows far more than we do. We need to find her, and fast.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not letting any leads slip past us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You reunite with Avidius after leaving the Paradimensional Tacet Field.

Though you entered together, what he saw within was the figure of Caligula, a tyrant reviled in Septimont's history, said to have wielded the Harbinger's power and brought calamity to the land. According to the Discord Slayer, the strange anomalies plaguing Ragunna are also tied to the Harbinger.

But who is the true Harbinger? The mystery only deepens. To uncover more clues, you turn to your telepathic skills to seek the Dark Tide's next move...

Chapters.Title: Use telepathy on the Dark Tide

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't see anything... I'm only getting jumbled voices.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Focus. I should be able to hear something.
Okay, everybody listen. Don't panic. Take the lift. It will bring you to safety...
The prototype Echoes in the depositories... Activate them all...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those voices... Zani and Carlotta?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're in Averardo Vault. The Dark Tide creations could be appearing there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's currently sheltering a large number of civilians...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's not waste time. We leave now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You attempt to connect telepathically with the Dark Tide's traces. No visions appear, but you hear the voices of Carlotta and Zani, hinting that Dark Tide creations may be appearing in Averardo Vault, where countless civilians have taken refuge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zani, status of the evacuation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eighty percent of Ragunna's residents have been relocated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... the Troupe of Fools hit a storm while ferrying people from the Riccioli Islands. Rough seas out there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust them to see it through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Montelli Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Carlotta! We've cleared the depositories as ordered. Ready to receive incoming supplies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Rinascita's greatest treasure has always been the people who built it. The next Cloudpuffer Express is due at any moment. Be ready to offload.

Dialogues.Speaker: Montelli Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood, ma'am!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: Anything unusual happening here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you mean the incident in Ragunna... You've likely already heard. A hoard of Tacet Discords has overrun the city, and Common Echoes are out of control...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Evacuation here is still on track. No anomalies detected in Averardo Vault… yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your assistance is appreciated, Sir Avidius. The residents from Egla Town have all been accounted for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am simply fulfilling my duty.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Strange... I clearly sensed the Dark Tide's presence around here. So why does everything seem normal?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: BANG—!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gunfire. We've got intruders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Avidius rush there, only to find most civilians already evacuated, with no signs of Dark Tide creations. Just as doubt begins to set in, the sound of familiar gunfire echoes through the Vault...
These Tidespawn... They've evolved fast. Mutation? Or...
And sure enough...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Entering a restricted zone armed, without triggering a single alarm...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be careful. Her abilities... are not normal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...All this? By her hand?

Options.PlotLineKey: All this in broad daylight? Brazen.
Let's not jump to conclusions just yet.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fiction and reality are starting to blur. Don't put your faith in appearances.
That... is what they really are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide can corrupt, and you carry its power. What proof do we have this isn't your doing?
You don't. Believe whatever you want.
By the sacred statues of the Divinity, evil shall know no peace. Only the righteous may taste eternity. Wickedness shall be purged by the blade, and those who consort with calamity shall fall...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Galbrena, demon wrought from ruin! You are not welcome here.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Fenrico...? Why would he be here?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have slaughtered my flock and ushered in ruin. The Sentinel's wrath is already upon you. I will cast you back into damnation myself before your carnage spreads any further.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should be howling in the Styx's depths, your soul aflame in the pit's cruelest fire... forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're offering me a shortcut back to hell, I'd honestly appreciate the favor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your heart holds no reverence for the Divine. Only... desecration and scorn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Demon, your sins are ripe for judgment. By the Highest Will's command, I shall strike down all that you have wrought. Justice shall be done!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She could've dodged that... but she took the hit to shield a civilian?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (And Fenrico... he knew innocents were here, but didn't hold back at all...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Righteous One, I come to cleanse Rinascita of a traitorous demon and avenge the blood debts of my people. Why raise your blade against me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita teeters on the edge of collapse. Now, more than ever, we must uphold the tenets of Unity and Salvation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The path to deliverance lies within the Civilization Capsule. Entrust it to me. By the authority bestowed upon me, I will open... the gates to the divine Paradise.

Options.PlotLineKey: You shouldn't be here, Fenrico.
I never told you about the Civilization Capsule.
They might not know, but I do. You're the Harbinger.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unless... You're not Fenrico at all. You... Who are you? What do you want?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Bloodshed cannot be avoided. Blood must pay for blood. The path born of injustice must be fortified with further transgressions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My goal is pure. Singular. All I've done, I've done so Rinascita survives the Divine reckoning and rises as a land free from sorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No understanding is needed. Only faith. When all hope seems lost, I... no, we are the beginning and the end. The absolution. And the grace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hand over the Civilization Capsule.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...So the Civilization Capsule is your goal after all. Lost your patience, have you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Death is the fruit of transgression. To resist it is to defy the will of the Divinity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You? You and your Divinity cannot end me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And these Dark Tide shams... Today, you face your reckoning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am the Enlightened One, anointed by the Divinity and crowned by Fate itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh, so you're the "core" of these abominations. Took long enough to hunt you down. Still pretending that mask isn't cracked?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mocked by fate, whispering poison, a demon reviled by all! You wield the Dark Tide's power, yet you dare judge me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's too bad I'm not the one judging. If the Dark Tide's power isn't enough to convince... How about we try this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The Envoys declare the guilt, but Imperator is the only true judge…"

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the Light of Imperator... REPENT!

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's... the Light of Genesis?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like the judgment is clear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These <ano=Tidespawn>hollow existences</ano> don't need your mercy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Protect the Civilization Capsule. That's what they're really after.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Following the gunshots, you witness what appears to be the Discord Slayer firing on civilians, only to realize these "civilians" are actually Dark Tide creations, Tidespawn, in disguise. Avidius accuses her of corrupting them with the very Dark Tide power she wields...

Suddenly, Fenrico, meant to be stationed at the Fabricatorium of the Deep, appears. He calls the woman "Galbrena" and unleashes a devastating assault. Galbrena takes the blow to shield the civilians behind her. When "Fenrico" demands that you give him the Civilization Capsule, you begin to doubt his true intentions.

Tensions erupt. Though pierced by Fenrico's sword, Galbrena "rises from death." Dismissing his words, she hurls her lantern-like Terminal into the air, where it detonates, scattering the Light of Genesis. The burst reveals more disguised Tidespawn as battle erupts…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How were they able to disguise themselves as humans?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never heard of any possessing such abilities...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their fangs are bared now. Don't hesitate. Let's end them all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The one mimicking the Primus is the heart. Take it down, and the rest will collapse with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's calling in more of them... We'll need to clear the rabble while waiting for our shot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alpha Tidespawn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That which cometh from the sea... Shall walk upon the land...

Dialogues.Speaker: Alpha Tidespawn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It shall work great wonders and mark the flesh of Its faithful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Alpha Tidespawn
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All who have ears to hear... Let them hear...

Dialogues.Speaker: ??? (False Sovereign)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius, you have received the blessing of my Master. Serve... your true Divinity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I shall never...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, now!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another dimension... within the Civilization Capsule.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why does it open up now? Was it when Avidius and I made contact?
Arbiter...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that Imperator's voice? Imperator... do you have more to tell me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Permissions detected—Arbiter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lifting imposed restrictions...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First Instance initiated. All probabilistic futures now revealed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Outcome verified. Blueprint compiled. Advancing to Phase Two.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Commencing simulation. Attempting civilization fit: Rinascita...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter. This moment was always foreseen. Now, it comes to pass...

Options.PlotLineKey: Imperator... is that really you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter, I grieve to say... I am but a message, set to activate in response to the presence of an Initiator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time, in this place, flows near still. A moment remains for us to speak.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I merged with Leviathan, It seized a fragment of my mind... and with it, a trace of my power to separate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew not the fullness of Its design. As a safeguard, I split elements of my core data into this space... the Civilization Capsule.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It records the origin and birth of the Rinascitan civilization, preserving their most ancient memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once, we drafted the first <ano=fate>Blueprint</ano> for these seaborne kin. Now, I have entombed it here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter, heed me now... let me unveil... Rinascita's beginnings...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Amidst the chaos, the Civilization Capsule is accidentally opened through your contact with Avidius, pulling you into its inner space.

There, you finally hear Imperator's last message about Rinascita and the origins of Leviathan…

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the beginning...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Life rose and fell with the tide

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The displaced and wandering

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: did follow My guidance

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They journeyed unto the archipelago

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There, I did leave <ano=Genesis Nexus>Knowledge and Technology</ano>

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: that they might walk the path to freedom

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your light blesses us...

Dialogues.Speaker: Praying Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We follow Your will...

Dialogues.Speaker: Admiring Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To build our republic...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Unity"

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: became the bedrock of civilization

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Leviathan seized upon mankind's "longing for Unity"

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: to manifest the civilization's shadow

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It spoke in My name

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wrought false miracles

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forged hollow grace

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feeding on stagnant, obedient minds

Dialogues.Speaker: Confused Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are blessed by the sea...

Dialogues.Speaker: Deranged Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By You, we are "unified"

Dialogues.Speaker: Deranged Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By You, we are "born"

Dialogues.Speaker: Delirious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the sea we came

Dialogues.Speaker: Delirious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: and to the sea we shall return

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the founding of civilization

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It had invaded their spirit and beliefs

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I rose against it

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only to unleash the Dark Tide

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It scarred Rinascita beyond measure

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... began to question

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: all I had done

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian doth steer Rinascita's fate

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: and I too, once guided Rinascita's course

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In truth... We were no different

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We both sought to mold civilization after Our own will

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those who truly walked the land

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: were never granted the right to choose

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Civilizations are bound with Threnodians

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No eternal solution doth exist

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have I the right...

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: to choose their fate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shaping of a civilization

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: must belong to its people

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only the people can decide where their future must lead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What followed, thou already knowest. I allowed the Threnodian to exist. I chose coexistence, using Myself to shackle It. I partook of Its blight, that I might comprehend It.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once, I did seek thy counsel. Thou granted me... the freedom to choose.

Options.PlotLineKey: I would do the same thing again.
You've done more than enough. Let me handle the rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just have one question... Why did the Civilization Capsule need the Threnodian's power to open?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When Leviathan and I were one, I split a sliver of Its frequency... a "memory." That memory I sealed here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Capsule was ever meant for thy hands. My design was that it should open only in the presence of thou and the Resonator bearing both My power and that of Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What if... that Resonator became the Threnodian's puppet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that came to pass, then Rinascita hath already fallen. And the truth within this Capsule would cease to matter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if she standeth with humanity, then this truth is hers to know. And thine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan was born from the dark side of mankind's "longing for Unity." Their fear of the sea shaped Its likeness as a great sea creature.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even at civilization's dawn, It had already tainted mankind's hearts. A primeval shadow lurking within the soul.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The opening of the Capsule shall stir the Rinascitans' oldest memories. Leviathan shall seek, through the Blueprint we created, to lay claim to Rinascita's fate anew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Rinascitans... wouldst walk a path "free of Divinity," they must face their past and "the most primeval fear." They must overcome the "shadow born of civilization."

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arbiter... the hour of farewell hath come. Go now. Gather every last hope... If all unfoldeth as it should, Rinascita shall be free of Divinity henceforth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Imperator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the shadows of the soul are at last dispelled, Rinascita shall welcome a true dawn. And humanity... shall have a future beyond any I could foresee.
The true faithful believed in Imperator. So too did Imperator believe in humanity.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Draw your sword.)
(Keep your sword sheathed.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You killed the Blessed Maiden before my eyes. Ragunna's disasters are tied to your actions... Now, tell me what I need to know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...If I told you I acted to save Cartethyia, would you believe me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place is protected by Imperator. For now, Leviathan can't hear us. This... is for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You killed the Blessed Maiden before my eyes. Ragunna's disasters are tied to your actions... Now, tell me what I need to know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...If I told you I acted to save Cartethyia, would you believe me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place is protected by Imperator. For now, Leviathan can't hear us. This... is for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia's Frequency
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, trust her. And trust me... Everything we've done... is to... defeat... Leviathan...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is her frequency...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need you to accept this. Cartethyia is "dead," but she may still "return." For that to happen... we need to kill Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Kill Leviathan? Didn't she absorb It when they merged?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now... Leviathan is on the verge of "rebirth."

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It stole some of the Sentinel's power. During your battle with the Blessed Maiden, It split off a trace of Its frequency and hid it in a Gem. I'm sure you've seen it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Gem ended up in the Fractsidus's hands. Their whole play in Rinascita? Use it to bring back Leviathan.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's always that group of lunatics...
I didn't think Leviathan would be that insidious...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the Fractsidus has been incubating the Threnodian... How long has this been going on?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps longer than we can imagine. Even your clash with Cartethyia may have been scripted. A setup to give Leviathan a shot at slipping the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know about that? Just who are you, Discord Slayer? I can't imagine Cartethyia keeping something that important from me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think of me as what I am... an avenger hunting Leviathan. As for the rest...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next Harbinger of the Dark Tide has surfaced. Until we find him or her... we keep this quiet to avoid the worst-case scenario.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our first priority is to find them. If we don't, the Dark Tide can overwhelm Ragunna again at any moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're saying this Harbinger is behind all the Dark Tide creations we're seeing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not all. The Harbinger resonates with Rinasicta's darkest emotions. Those emotions act as Anchors, pulling horror into form and speeding the tidespawn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the emotion is strong enough, and the Harbinger is near... Those things "evolve." They feed off the Harbinger's thoughts and memories to become more real. Some even start to look... human.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've noticed it. The Tidespawn in Ragunna are starting to mimic us. Which means...

Options.PlotLineKey: The Harbinger is in Ragunna.
We may be close to the Harbinger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. I've always hunted the Dark Tide's creations—each one shares slivers of thought and memory. I kill them, and I take what they know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've been watching you. They want the Civilization Capsule. So... I followed you. Tracked your movements, figured if I stayed close, sooner or later I'd find the Tidespawn's "core." Maybe even the Harbinger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Capsule only unlocks with both the Sentinel and Threnodian's power, and it opened the moment you and that Gladiator touched it, so...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You think it's Avidius? But you carry the Dark Tide's power too...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Caution is a virtue in a hunter. You're right. The Dark Tide is in me... But Leviathan stopped counting me among the living a long time ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And this power... It's mine now. Who I turn it against is my choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're welcome to try and stop me. But me? I'm not stopping this hunt any time soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When calamity strikes, I trust... you'll know exactly where to point your blade.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll trust you. For now.
I trust Cartethyia's judgement.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... good. Then hunt with me. Until we give Leviathan a death worth talking about. Loud, messy, unforgettable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel's frequency is gone. I guess the time for talking is over. Leviathan's power is spreading, and this space is about to collapse. We need to find a way out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The Sentinel reveals the origins of Leviathan and Rinascita. After long contemplation, They entrusted humanity with the right to decide the course of civilization, sacrificing Themself to become a shackle to bind the Threnodian. What followed, you already know well...

After Imperator's voice fades, Galbrena appears. You confront her, but she simply tosses you Cartethyia's pendant. Resonating with it, you confirm it is real, but the message embedded in Cartethyia's frequency only deepens the mystery: everything they have done is for one purpose—to defeat Leviathan.

Galbrena explains that Leviathan is on the verge of rebirth, incubated by the Fractsidus using the Threnodian's Gem. To prevent their plan from falling into the wrong hands, she cannot reveal more. She asks you to accept one truth: the Blessed Maiden is dead, and only by defeating Leviathan can she be "resurrected."

The priority now is finding the new Harbinger of the Dark Tide. Galbrena already suspects Avidius, but you still harbor doubts about the Dark Tide power she carries. She responds by saying that whether you trust her or not, her hunt will go on.

As the Sentinel's frequency fades completely and the space begins to collapse, you choose to form a temporary alliance with the Discord Slayer.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These things... They're all Tidespawn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Civilization Capsule was tainted by the Dark Tide. That's how I got in... followed the corruption straight through.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you can enter the Dark Tide. No wonder we couldn't find you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, but the frequencies there are chaotic. I locked onto yours and followed it through the storm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have access to core data. But Avidius, he might've been swept into the frequency vortex. Hard to say where he's landed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to move fast to find him. Figure out who he really is before the next wave of Tidespawn hits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The collapse is accelerating. Our way out is closing fast...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Faster. We're almost there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The exit is at the end of this wind trail. Stay on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}! Good... looks like you haven't run into too much trouble.

Options.PlotLineKey: How long was I gone?
What happened when I was gone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It hasn't been long since you disappeared into the rift. Once that thing masquerading as Fenrico was slain, the other Tidespawn didn't last.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was the last one. With the family's Private Echo arsenal backing us up, we held the line just fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Surely you didn't think we'd fall apart without you? We Ragunnesi are made of sterner stuff than that. We handled those creatures just fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Feilian Beringal... When the "core" was destroyed, the other Tidespawn lost their form. For now, the Vault is secure. At least until the next wave spawns.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd set up Order Terminals around the perimeter though. They'll detect humanoid mimics and prevent new Tidespawn from forming here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Might I ask...

Options.PlotLineKey: She's an ally for now.
You can trust her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where's that Gladiator from Septimont?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir Avidius made it out of the rift before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... he didn't look great. Kept muttering about needing to "stop the crisis," then off he went, like a man on fire.

Options.PlotLineKey: We need to track him down.
That one really knows how to pick his moments...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Give me your hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I left a mark on Avidius during our fight earlier. With <ano=the Tacet Discord "Beholder">Balor's</ano> power, I can tap into his sight. We'll find his trail.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must... move quickly...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Silence, you maddening whispers!

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... I'll be damned before I accept a fate like that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There must be something left I can still do...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I won't let the same tragedy... happen twice...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...He's headed for Thessaleo Fells.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've lost contact with Cantarella. The Beacon on her end appears to have been destroyed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dark clouds are gathering over Thessaleo Fells... Something is definitely wrong.

Options.PlotLineKey: The two of us will go reinforce her.
You stay and protect the civilians here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Very well. We'll hold the line. Zani, call in the family's transport Echoes. We'll assist {PlayerName} where we can.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't complicate things. Put those Echoes toward supply runs instead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stay close. We're taking the sky route.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Escaping the Civilization Capsule with Galbrena, you learn that the Averardo Vault crisis has passed, but Avidius has vanished.

Using her abilities, Galbrena tracks his location, and together you ride her wind trail toward Thessaleo Fells.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Manipulating the air to form a wind trail... Is that your Resonance Ability?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One of them. I have the Tacet Discord <ano=half-bird half-woman>Harpyia</ano> within me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not an Echo, but a Tacet Discord itself... So you can absorb them directly?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can say that. Balor is one of many.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One of many... Now I'm really curious about you and your abilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we live through this, maybe I'll tell you. But right now...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to find the Harbinger. Do you know how we can identify them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First things first, they'll be corrupted by the Dark Tide. But the signs aren't always so visible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll have to look for associated side effects, and prepare for what they might bring.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've entered Thessaleo Fells. I can already sense the Tidespawn up ahead...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's... a Fisalia member! We need to help him!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fisalia Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, it's {PlayerName}! Thank the Sentinel!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fisalia Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dark Tide creations swarmed without warning. We were overrun before we could—

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Move aside. We'll clean up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fisalia Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you! Lady Cantarella is still on the frontlines fighting. Would you please help to reinforce her position?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's too late, my Lady... My mind... can't be fixed. Save your potions for those who still have hope...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I only beg... don't let me die a monster. Don't let me become Leviathan's puppet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: GhhhaaAAAAGH—! I see it... The End Times... Paradise... descending at last! AHAHAHAHA!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}... She is... Why are you with her?

Options.PlotLineKey: Trust me. I'll explain later.
Let's handle the crisis first, and I'll explain later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The Fisalia bloodline's ties with Leviathan run too deep. Their ancient fears were the first to be awakened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the true horror of the evolved Dark Tide. It feeds on human despair, warping that frequency to form Tidespawn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your family's "antidote" can still cure those lightly infected. But for those whose corruption runs deep, like him... Their frequencies cannot be reversed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All we can offer is the dignity of dying as a human.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My Lady... don't let me burden... those who still have hope...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Matriarch of Fisalia, I understand the cruelty of such a choice. If you cannot strike the final blow... allow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Fisalia blood must be ended by Fisalia hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you... May glory return to the Fisalias...

Options.PlotLineKey: Gilberto...
Cantarella...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The dead rest. The living march forward... The Fisalia will never forget its fallen sons and daughters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia remains secure in the Fisalia estate. But the Divinity's statue began whispering in our minds... Then came the Tidespawn soon after.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was Leviathan's voice. Something has... awakened It.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's very likely Avidius. Right now, everything is riding on us finding him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Septimontian Gladiator... Our scouts saw him advancing into the depths of Thessaleo Fells.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Cantarella! {PlayerName}! Reinforcements have arrived!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thessaleo Fells... It's already... Attention! Deploy all Acolytes to set up temporary Resonance Beacons. Scattering the Light of Genesis will hold back the Tidespawn!

Dialogues.Speaker: Resolute Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Acolyte Phoebe! A cluster of Tidespawn is marching toward the depths of Thessaleo Fells！

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, Avidius is our mission.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll use my Forte to diffuse the family's antidote. It should help to mitigate the Dark Tide's influence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll triage the wounded and fortify this position. The Order's Acolytes will clear a path for you. Please, you have to stop this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Resolute Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether the Sentinel comes or not, we are Their will made flesh! We protect Rinascita!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fearless Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O Light of Genesis, shield us! As we were at the dawn, so we stand today as the Sentinel's soldiers!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Tidespawn have already swarmed Thessaleo Fells. There, you witness the true horror of the Dark Tide. Facing Gilberto, who is on the verge of becoming a Tidespawn himself, Cantarella makes the painful choice to end his suffering and preserve his humanity in death.

The departed may rest, but the living must carry on. Avidius has already set out toward the depths of the Fells. Meanwhile, the Acolytes of the Order arrive in time to clear a path for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order's Acolytes are holding off the other Tidespawn. This is our chance to go straight for the source.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... it's you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive me... that you have to see me like this...

Options.PlotLineKey: What happened to you, Avidius?
Why has Thessaleo Fells become like this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the Civilization Capsule opened, I was dragged inside. A black frequency took hold of me. Swallowed me whole.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw Rinascita's beginnings, and the memories of... so many of its people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw him too—Caligula. His face was like mine... He was my past, and the future I am meant to inherit...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Leviathan used the Dark Tide's frequency to force those memories into him.

Options.PlotLineKey: You said you'd become the master of your own destiny!
No one gets to decide who you are!

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I once said... that I would write my own story... define my own "existence"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But after I left that space, I suddenly felt the Tidespawn's movements. They were converging on Thessaleo Fells. I still wanted... to do something, anything, to stop the devastation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But once again, I stepped blindly into the <ano=Fate>churning river of Chaos</ano>. The Fisalia's oldest memories awoke ahead of time. Because of me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Countless Tidespawn emerged in my wake. I tried to drive them back, but I... overestimated myself... and was corrupted by them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My hopes and dreams... all of it was real. So why? Why did it all come to this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From Septimont to Ragunna, the blame lies with me. Perhaps this is the fate I could never outrun. Caligula's fate... It's calling to me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Damn it. His mind is being consumed by Caligula's memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the role Fate wrote for me. Fate decrees I become the Mad King. So why... why should I reject its crown?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am the one who glimpsed "Fate" itself... And now, I will reveal it to the world...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But who can truly know the mind of Fate... That is why I will become it. I will wear its face... that foolish, divine mask no mortal can comprehend.

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am the King... bearer of extraordinary power, risen from the dark tides. I shall quiet the waters and still the tempest...

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I shall be crowned in glory... with the blood of the old king.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
In the depths of Thessaleo Fells, you finally find Avidius. But he has already been implanted with Caligula's memories and deeply corrupted by the Dark Tide.

Sensing the stirrings of Tidespawn, he came here intending to stop the disaster. But his arrival awakened the Fisalias' oldest memories, calling forth countless Tidespawn...

Fate's cruel joke breaks his spirit. He descends into madness, becoming the Mad King Caligula, and raises his blade against you...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius...

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unwritten One, I have no need for your pity.

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the deepest dark, I rise against your purest light. Let us see which is worthy of a true ruler.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you believe he was once an honorable Gladiator...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then fight him. Make him remember who he truly is.

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can write my own fate. And rewrite theirs.

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can quench their hunger... Or ignite their fury.

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will tear down this wretched, false world... and ride the only Truth that endures for eternity... Death.

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I once scorned the weakness of others. Now I see... My own heart trembles just the same. How pitiful...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …His attacks are slowing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His will is stirring within the Dark Tide. Don't let up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your memories. Your emotions... They weren't all lies. Reach for them. Find what was your Truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius! Remember who you are. Remember the man you wanted to become!

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am... human. Not one of these monsters...

Dialogues.Speaker: The Mad King: Caligula (Avidius)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This will be... my final glory...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius! Remember who you are. Remember the man you wanted to become...

Dialogues.Speaker: The Dark Tide's "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fate lies within the Dark Tide. No one escapes the net it casts.

Dialogues.Speaker: The Dark Tide's "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wield the Dark Tide's power... And it will consume you in turn.

Dialogues.Speaker: The Dark Tide's "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come back... Come back to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am... nothing like you...

Dialogues.Speaker: The Dark Tide's "Whispers"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh. You... How do you plan to resist us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There must be a way...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That girl... Was she devoured by the Tide too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait! If you keep going, the Dark Tide will swallow you completely!

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Who Fell Into The Dark TIde
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know... the Dark Tide devours everything. Assimilates everything. If I can't escape it... then I'll use it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Who Fell Into The Dark TIde
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's already flowing inside of me... So why can't I turn it against them? Why can't I... be the one who devours them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Who Fell Into The Dark TIde
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These "false frequencies" need me to "survive." If this power... doesn't want to listen to me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Who Fell Into The Dark TIde
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I'll show it who's the real boss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Who Fell Into The Dark TIde
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fate... It may be loud, but I don't think it's that strong. I... don't believe in it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A memory left behind in the Dark Tide...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's right... In this war against Fate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still have a move to make.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Avidius's consciousness has sunk into the Dark Tide, struggling desperately against its whispers.

A girl passes before him... He sees that she, too, has been tainted by the Dark Tide. He moves to stop her, but watches as she turns the Dark Tide's power against itself, absorbing the surrounding Tidespawn.

The girl turns toward him. Before Avidius's eyes, she slowly merges with the image of Galbrena, then fades away.

While only a fragmented memory, it reminds Avidius that even in this war against fate, there is still something he can do...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want it to be a story that gives people hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By my spear, I vow to protect my allies...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And crush... the hearts of the evil.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will absorb all of the Tidespawn...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Kill me, and the calamity ends here.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius!

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's no time, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Discord Slayer, I saw your past in the Tide. I know what you seek to do...

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take my power... And finish it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Avidius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That too is my wish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I promise I will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Give me all your bitterness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will... make them pay.

Dialogues.Speaker: ??? (Cristoforo)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pathetic as he was, in his final moments...

Dialogues.Speaker: ??? (Cristoforo)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He outran his fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: ??? (Cristoforo)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, why greet our reunion with animosity?

Dialogues.Speaker: ??? (Cristoforo)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before the tides of fate, we are all but… players on a stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A truly moving scene. A pitiful, doomed soul struggling to reclaim his fate in the final hour.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
