Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Alas, his script was written long ago. In this scene, he was always fated to exit.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Quillbearer finally takes the stage.
Avidius was your creation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A lie told often enough becomes the truth. Weave memory, history, experience, and you can craft a man who "exists in the minds of others."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But to become truly "real"... that path was still far off. I merely gave him form, a mask of flesh and blood, fit to walk the world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, the breath that could give him life... was his alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, a being born of lies, grasping for meaning in a world that offers none! Such a pursuit demands the courage to question the meaning of one's existence. Yes, it demands pain...

Options.PlotLineKey: As creators go, you're rather heartless.
Have you no compassion for your own creation？

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you not see? I did. His intentions, his ambitions, his darkness, his weakness... To lay a soul bare is not always an act of cruelty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Humanity is Fate's plaything. I simply showed them the strings. I lit the fire, the hunger that might ignite their free will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through contradictions and conflicts, pain brings metamorphosis. Tragedy breeds transcendence. Only then may a soul rise beyond itself... and touch the gates of "immortality."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should you still insist on my cruelty... well, high praise indeed. At the very least, it proves this story has stirred your pity and fervor. That alone earns you the right to read through to the final act.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go then. To Septimont. The curtain is drawing. There, I shall rewrite Rinascita's fate... with the Dark Tide as my ink.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Will you suffer in silence beneath Fate's poisoned arrows, or rise to defy this world's endless trials? I, too, await your final answer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You brought ruin to Rinascita. You think you're just walking away?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My stage lies elsewhere. In this scene, I am but a herald.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But since you're so eager, I'll leave you with one final clue. I've never had much fondness for overwrought dramatic irony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide has already tainted the Civilization Capsule. It no longer requires the Threnodian's authority to be opened… Just a single drop of the Tide's nectar will suffice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So tell me, how could an existence born of the Dark Tide ever serve as its "Anchor of Reality"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be forewarned. When dark waters recede, the truth beneath the surface... shall come to light.

Options.PlotLineKey: I hope you understood what he meant.
Wait, so Avidius wasn't the Harbinger?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Harbinger of the Dark Tide is the Anchor of Reality of all Tidespawn. That means it must be a real, existing person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I was absorbing the Tidespawn, I felt it. Avidius was also born of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then why didn't the "Light of Imperator" reveal his true form?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because his intentions and words were real. He may not have shone as brightly as the sun, but in walking beneath its light, he still caught its glow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that unshakable resolve not to become a pawn of the darkness, even unto death... That created his own Truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why he played right into the Quillbearer's hands. A scapegoat, the perfect "sacrifice" to bury the truth. All his noble wishes were twisted. Such cruel irony can rot for all I care...

Options.PlotLineKey: He still stopped Ragunna from falling to the Dark Tide.
He still succeeded in changing his fate.
That playwright is the true culprit.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius shouldn't have had to bear such a fate... I will carry on his fight. I'll keep writing the story he believed in, the story that gives people hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. As he wished... we must stop the greater tragedy that's coming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's return to Cantarella and check on the wounded. If Avidius wasn't the Harbinger, that means we missed something...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
In the end, Avidius sacrifices his life to stop the Dark Tide outbreak in Ragunna. At last, the hidden Quillbearer, Cristoforo, reveals himself. He invites you to step into the final act and leaves you with a cryptic riddle.

Galbrena hands you the paper crane Avidius left behind. Although she sensed Avidius was a creation of the Dark Tide, the Harbinger itself must be "a real, existing person," which means the true Harbinger is someone else.

The Light of Genesis never revealed Avidius's true form because he had already created his own Truth—one defined by his humanity. You mourn his fate and vow to keep his belief that fate can be defied alive...

Chapters.Title: Talk to the scared little girl

Dialogues.Speaker: Scared Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm so scared...

Options.PlotLineKey: Everything's okay, don't worry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scared Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, it's you, the great hero {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scared Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella told me stories about you. She said you're just like the heroes in the adventure tales. Brave and determined...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scared Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...But... You can't save everyone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't go... Don't leave... Don't abandon us...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Cartethyia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mortals need salvation... Mortals need unity...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Righteous One... open the ascendant gates for me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This world doesn't belong to you, Leviathan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chimera!

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How are you feeling, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stand down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I said, stand down. Fall back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Panicked Fisalia Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But, Lady Cantarella, we all saw it… just now—

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enough. I told you to stand down. You've withstood the "whispers" before. Will you forget your loyalty to your comrades in the face of fear?

Dialogues.Speaker: Panicked Fisalia Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry, Lady Cantarella... and {PlayerName}. We... We lost our composure...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leviathan is a master at finding the cracks in one's spirit to tear it asunder. Go do what you must. I'll handle this.

Options.PlotLineKey: What just happened...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Certain emotions between you and the others resonated. Your Tacet Mark opened a "portal," pulling you into another illusion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That "portal" fed on your presence to spread malice and fear... But before it could fully take shape, I broke into your illusion and shut it down.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw Fenrico, Mya, and Cartethyia... They all passed through that gate. What exactly lies beyond it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the realm Leviathan created. The Journeying Paradise.

Options.PlotLineKey: If those gates opened because of me...
Then does that mean—

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Avidius was Cristoforo's decoy. He planted that decoy in Septimont for years... When the waters recede, the truth shall come to light...

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}... you are the new Harbinger of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Galbrena make your way back, checking on the wounded along the way.

While comforting a little girl, your Tacet Mark suddenly flares with an ominous glow. The girl transforms into a Tidespawn, and everything around you freezes. A whisper from Cartethyia brushes against your ear, and a vast gate appears in the distance. Galbrena breaks from her stillness and erupts in flames, firing a bullet at the gate while summoning a Tacet Discord named Chimera to strike at you—

You snap awake from the "illusion" to see the terrified and hostile faces of the Fisalias before you.

Cantarella calms them and explains that your emotions resonated with those around you, causing your Tacet Mark to open a "portal" that dragged you into the illusion. This "portal" fed on your presence to spread malice and fear into the real world. But before it could fully take shape, Galbrena broke into the illusion and stopped it.

A chilling realization strikes you. If that "portal" opened because of you, then it can only mean one thing. The Harbinger of the Dark Tide... is you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidespawn have fully retreated. The situation around Thessaleo Fells is improving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like the Order has already transported most of the wounded to Averardo Vault.

Dialogues.Speaker: Galbrena
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... as for the rest... the scars Leviathan left on their minds still need time to heal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Amedeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Slowly they join the crowd pilgriming toward the kingdom rising in the dark waves… Those blessed by the sea are ever doomed to bear its curse."

Dialogues.Speaker: Amedeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He cursed the Ragunnesi with a broken sonnet. No, more than that... He cursed all of Rinascita! Now, his curse is coming true...

Options.PlotLineKey: Is he alright...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, {PlayerName}! Haven't you heard? Lately, the Ragunnesi have started having "nightmares." That's probably what he's referring to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Amedeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In my dreams I saw things... monsters I've never seen before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Amedeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it's because I've had my nose buried in that "mysterious playwright's unfinished draft"... those hobgoblins, banshees, and beasties are all carved into my mind now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Amedeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought it was just a dream. Just… imagination. But then… one day, in the wilds… By the Sentinel, I saw one. Every infernal detail exactly as I dreamt it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Amedeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The playwright conjured illusions with words. Summoned ghosts, stitched nightmares into verses, turned phantasm into flesh! These are HIS verses... HIS CURSES!

Dialogues.Speaker: Amedeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think about it! Monstrous fiends once trapped in myth and sonnet are now strutting on stage! He planted the seeds... centuries ago...

Options.PlotLineKey: That mysterious playwright...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm… sounds like a perfect premise for a ballad. I wouldn't mind meeting some of these storybook monsters myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Amedeo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Ciaccona… you… you're not afraid of them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our souls are as eternal as theirs. How could they possibly harm us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ciaccona
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, if the play is still unfinished, then the ending is ours to write, isn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nevana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Zani… I'm so sorry. I'll head back right away…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No worries. If you're feeling low, it's good to step out and get some air.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, buongiorno, {PlayerName}. If you're here for banking... you'll have to wait.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did something happen to her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nevana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your concern... I just had a vivid dream... about my grandmother who passed away some time ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nevana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I woke up, I could still SEE her, sitting right beside me. Her smile was gentle... just like when I was little. She used to sing me to sleep with lullabies…

Dialogues.Speaker: Nevana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I told her how much I missed her, and she listened quietly, just like always. Then she stood up and said goodbye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nevana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw her walk through a door. I tried to follow, but she stopped me. She said, "Don't follow me. And don't go gently through those gates." Then I woke up... again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nevana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was it a dream within a dream? Or was it a vision pulled from a memory? But her face, her voice... it all felt so real...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Capisco. I get it. I'll handle your desk. Go home. Take the day to rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nevana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Miss Zani. But I think... my grandmother was trying to tell me something. That I can't stay trapped in grief and the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nevana
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I'll keep going with today's work. Sorry to worry you all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Vivian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Acolyte Phoebe, "Paradise"... It really exists...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But...

Dialogues.Speaker: Vivian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw it in my dreams. It was a revelation from the Sentinel...

Options.PlotLineKey: A revelation from the Sentinel...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hello there {PlayerName}. May the Sentinel's grace be upon you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Vivian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}... you're the Laureate of the Carnevale! That means you've heard the Sentinel's voice too! You can help me prove it, can't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Vivian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My dreams must be divine revelations! I saw it all, the "City of Eternal Bliss" and "Path of Glorious Ascension." It was so clear...

Dialogues.Speaker: Vivian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That kingdom is the afterlife. They told me that to gain entry, one needs only forsake all hope and call Their name...

Options.PlotLineKey: But surely not everyone can enter the "true Paradise"...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Vivian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …You're right to remind me. We mustn't forget the Sentinel's teachings to live righteously here in the mortal world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Vivian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Acolyte Phoebe, let's hold fast to that. We will reach that "Kingdom of Eternal Bliss."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've always believed "Paradise" was real, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it is truly sacred and beautiful... why ask us to "forsake all hope" to enter?
